message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Caspofungin inhibits 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, which is required for the formation of the fungal cell wall, leading to cell death. This is different from the mechanisms of action of the other options, which include pore formation in cell membranes (amphotericin B), inhibition of ergosterol synthesis (azoles), and inhibition of squalene epoxidase (terbinafine).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Caspofungin belongs to the echinocandin class of antifungal drugs and it works by inhibiting the synthesis of 1,3-beta-glucan, an essential component of the fungal cell wall. This leads to cell wall destabilization and eventual cell death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only caspofungin inhibits 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, an enzyme involved in cell wall synthesis in fungi, leading to cell lysis and death.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only caspofungin inhibits 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, an enzyme essential for the synthesis of fungal cell walls.

We refer to the FDA label for caspofungin for help. Caspofungin inhibits 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, an enzyme responsible for the synthesis of beta-glucan in the fungal cell wall. This leads to the weakening and ultimately the death of the fungal cell.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only caspofungin works by inhibiting 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, which is important for the integrity of fungal cell walls.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Caspofungin inhibits the synthesis of 1,3-Beta-glucan in the fungal cell wall, resulting in cell death. This drug is used to treat systemic fungal infections, including esophageal candidiasis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only caspofungin works by inhibiting 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, an enzyme important for the synthesis of the cell wall of fungi. This ultimately causes cell death of the fungi causing the esophageal candidiasis in the boy with HIV.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, only caspofungin inhibits 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, which is essential for formation of fungal cell walls. This disruption leads to cell death.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Among the options, caspofungin inhibits 1,3-Beta-glucan synthase, which is responsible for the synthesis of beta-glucans in the fungal cell wall. By inhibiting this enzyme, the drug weakens the cell wall and prevents the growth and proliferation of the fungus.
